How did Instagram became popular in the first place? I can't see the appeal.
@izadcmuda Same here. I completely agree with this author about it: http://bit.ly/d3t53e You're basically just taking your photos and ruining them.
@JohnFail I actually don't use any photo app to shoot, as the API simply don't allow you to save images size as big as the default app (and I shoot photos then post it using instagram)
Crossing my fingers to see instagram make its way to Android. Until then, picplz FTW!
do you like the design of instagram?

I would love for Instagram to make its way to Android.  I use picplz as well, but the filters are not as good as Instagram.  Picplz has far more advanced features, but the filters are not up to par....

Instagram is great for shooting in-door parties. With Instagram, 90% of the photos could feel right after filtering, while the standard iPhone photos would be just deleted or thrown out, especially with drunk photos.
@itsnotvalid Wanting to apply these filters to make photos look "vintage" just doesn't seem to have a point to me.
@JohnFail but many finds that helpful to make the original photo "look nicer" I find that actually is, in terms of aesthetic view (not a technical one)
Someone's using Instagram's API to make a real browsable website: http://instagre.at/#/by/rodbegbie/
@rodbegbie This is cool!  I just wish I could see my own photos as well.
soo kewl !!
@itsnotvalid I can respect that. It all comes down to preference in the end.

I am coming to the conclusion that a social site requires crowd sourced development to be complete: I.e. an API to allow for enhancements. Instagram is like Twitter -- made bettery by apps
They need to launch Android app to reach out to this mobile users segment
I agree with 'hardaway' Instagram needs to have a good API, as some innovative apps based developed using the API will help in growing the eco system around Instagram.
